businessInfo.text: How long has your business been running?
What is your current yearly revenue level?

low.description:
You're in the early stages of your business growth, which presents both challenges and opportunities.

At this revenue level, your focus should be on establishing product-market fit and creating reliable systems. Many businesses at this stage struggle with inconsistent cash flow and wearing too many hats simultaneously. Your primary goal should be to validate your business model and begin building repeatable processes that can scale.

The good news is there's tremendous room for growth, and small improvements can yield significant percentage gains. Consider focusing on a specific niche or service that can become your signature offering.

mid.description:
You've proven your business concept and achieved meaningful traction!

This middle revenue band is often where businesses experience their most significant growing pains. You're likely transitioning from doing everything yourself to building a team, which brings management challenges.

Many businesses at this stage struggle with delegation, maintaining quality as they scale, and implementing proper systems. Your priorities should include standardizing operations, developing your leadership skills, and creating a management structure that doesn't rely solely on you.

The $500k threshold often requires a fundamental shift from entrepreneur to business leader.

high.description:
You've built a substantial business already, very few people get to this level, so well done first of all!

At this revenue level, your challenges likely center around scaling operations, managing larger teams, and maintaining the quality that got you here.

Many businesses at this stage struggle with strategic growth planning, leadership team development, and establishing scalable processes across departments.

Your focus should be on creating robust management systems, developing future leaders within your organization, and working strategically rather than tactically.

The path forward requires thinking bigger while ensuring your foundation remains solid.

questions.text: Does every team member understand the company's mission, vision, and goals?
Does the company have a clear process for managers doing 1:1's with their employees?
Does the company have a clear process for Performance Reviews with employees?
Are your staff members clear on their goals and what is expected for them to deliver?
Are employees comfortable giving honest feedback to leadership?

low.title: Needs Improvement
low.description:
Your Team Management needs improving. A company's team management is the backbone of its success.

Companies with effective staff oversight must implement consistent management processes, as these drive the company forward. While firefighting is inevitable, without structured management systems in place, long-term growth will remain slow.

Companies that are managing staff need to have good management processes in place that happen consistently, as this is what helps a company drive forward. There are always fires to be fought, but without consistent management processes, long-term growth will be very slow.

mid.title: Shows Promise
mid.description:
Your Team Management shows promise but needs improvement. A company's team management is the backbone of its success.

Companies managing staff effectively require consistent, well-structured management processes to drive forward progress. While you have some systems in place, there's room for improvement. You're handling the day-to-day challenges, but enhancing your management consistency would accelerate long-term growth.

high.title: On Point
high.description:
Great work! Your Team Management is on point. A company's team management is the backbone of its success, and you've clearly established effective systems.

Your consistent management processes are providing the foundation needed to drive your company forward.

While you're already excelling, there's always room for advanced strategies to further enhance your team's performance and streamline growth.

questions.text: Will your business continue to operate and grow if you take a 3 month holiday and don't communicate with your team?
Is your business able to deliver its product/service/content without depending on you personally?
Are all staff members that report to you, growing and taking on more responsibility?
Are you and your managers aware of people's natural strengths and weaknesses in order to delegate to people's strengths?
Do you and your managers spend time on high-value strategic work, rather than being stuck in day-to-day tasks?

low.title: Needs Improvement
low.description:
Your Delegation skills need improving. Effective delegation is a cornerstone of successful leadership and business growth.

Leaders who struggle with delegation often find themselves overwhelmed with tasks that could be handled by team members, limiting both personal productivity and team development.

Without structured delegation processes, you risk becoming a bottleneck in your organization and holding back the long-term growth of your team.

mid.title: Shows Promise
mid.description:
Your Delegation approach shows promise but needs improvement. Effective delegation is a cornerstone of successful leadership and business growth.

While you've begun delegating some responsibilities, there's room to develop a more systematic approach. You're making progress in distributing tasks, but improving your delegation framework would further reduce bottlenecks and accelerate team development.

high.title: Impressive
high.description:
Great work! Your Delegation skills are impressive. Effective delegation is a cornerstone of successful leadership, and you've clearly mastered the fundamentals.

Your thoughtful approach to distributing responsibilities empowers your team while freeing you to focus on strategic priorities. While you're already excelling, there are always advanced delegation techniques that could further enhance team autonomy and organizational efficiency.

questions.text: Are jobs clearly defined with areas of responsibilities and expected outcomes?
Does the individual a new staff member will report to make the final hiring decision?
Do most new hires stay at least 1 year with the company?
Do most employees who pass the hiring process generally perform well in their roles?
Is your recruitment process documented and consistent across the company?

low.title: Needs Improvement
low.description:
Your Hiring Processes need improving. Effective recruitment is the foundation of organizational success and sustainable growth.

Companies with underdeveloped hiring systems often struggle with poor candidate selection, extended vacancies, and increased turnover costs. Without structured and consistent recruitment practices, you risk bringing in misaligned talent that can undermine team dynamics and cause slow long-term growth.

mid.title: Shows Promise
mid.description:
Your Hiring Processes show promise but need refinement. Effective recruitment is the foundation of organizational success and sustainable growth.

While you've established some recruitment systems, there's room to develop a more comprehensive approach. Improving your process would reduce hiring mistakes and accelerate team performance.

high.title: Impressive
high.description:
Great work! Your Hiring Processes are impressive. Effective recruitment is the foundation of organizational success, and you've clearly established robust systems.

Your thorough approach to candidate selection consistently brings in qualified talent that aligns with your company values and objectives. While you're already excelling, there are always advanced recruitment techniques that could further enhance your talent pipeline and reduce time-to-hire.

questions.text: Do you have regular KPI/OKR reporting?
Do you know how much it costs to acquire a customer (CAC) vs. their lifetime value (LTV)?
Do you track your monthly revenue, expenses, and profit consistently?
Do you monitor your conversion rates across your sales funnel (e.g., lead to customer)?
Do all employees have clear KPIs tied to business objectives?

low.title: Needs Improvement
low.description:
Your KPI Systems need improving. Effective performance tracking is the compass that guides strategic decision-making and business growth.

Organizations with underdeveloped metrics often operate on gut feelings rather than data, leading to misaligned priorities and wasted resources. Without structured KPI reporting and success measurement processes, you lack the insights needed to identify bottlenecks, finding profitable opportunities and drive long-term growth.

mid.title: Shows Promise
mid.description:
Your KPI Systems show promise but need improvement. Effective performance tracking is the compass that guides strategic decision-making and business growth.

While you've implemented some KPI tracking, there's room to develop a more comprehensive approach. You're collecting some useful data, but it's key to measure and know the critical numbers for your business success, as these metrics gives actionable insights that accelerate progress.

high.title: Impressive
high.description:
Great work! Your KPI Systems are impressive. Effective performance tracking is the compass that guides strategic decision-making, and you've clearly established robust processes.

Your thoughtful approach to KPI selection and reporting consistently provides the insights needed to make data-driven decisions and course corrections. While you're already excelling, there are always advanced techniques that could further enhance your predictive capabilities and strategic planning.
